metadata.title: CVE-2019-11234 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
FreeRADIUS before 3.0.19 does not prevent use of reflection forauthentication spoofing, aka a "Dragonblood" issue, a similar issue toCVE-2019-9497.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11234` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freeradius - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.1
freeradius-common - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.1
freeradius-config - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.1
freeradius-dhcp - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.1
freeradius-iodbc - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.1
freeradius-krb5 - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.1
freeradius-ldap - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.1
freeradius-memcached - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.1
freeradius-mysql - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.1
freeradius-postgresql - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.1
freeradius-redis - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.1
freeradius-rest - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.1
freeradius-utils - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.1
freeradius-yubikey - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.1
libfreeradius3 - 3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: freeradius package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.0.16+dfsg-1ubuntu3.1').
